section.title: Statement of Work
section.para: The goal of this project is to create a automatically grading system which enhances the current one for C211 to all courses in the university.
section.simpara: The MAGS (McKelvey Autograding System) is the current system used by the C211 Introduction to Computing course at Indiana University. This first version used by the class works well, but has limitations and bugs which have not been addressed or fixed during its lifetime. A new version of MAGS which scales to multiple classrooms and courses, as well as languages and systems should be developed. This project will create this new version, enhancing the existing system to include better student management, roster management, grade reporting, and handling of multiple class sections.

The application developed should be accessible through multiple channels, be clearly and easily extensible without affecting the overall stability of the system, and should be supportable by a single developer or associate instructor for the entire school, without much effort from the specific classes or courses being necessary. Additionally, the application should be open-source and available publically for use by other Universities.

In addition to the above, this project will create a number of documents with the express intent and purpose of ensuring the maintainability and longevity of the project. This means that the project should be able to continue even if there exists a long period of inactivity or if there is a discontinuity of the development team which might normally lead to a loss of expertise in the system. That is, it should be possible for a new developer to enter the system and learn how to use and work and develop the system without the mentorship of an existing developer if at all possible.
